meanings.definition: To make someone or something experience a particular thing
meanings.sent1: She was subjecting her cat to a bath for the first time.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was subjecting the new drug to rigorous testing.
meanings.sent3: The kids were subjecting the poor teacher to their endless questions.
meanings.sent4: The storm was subjecting the old house to its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The chef was subjecting the dough to repeated kneading to make the perfect bread.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to be affected by something
meanings.sent1: The loud music was subjecting her ears to discomfort.
meanings.sent2: The virus was subjecting the population to illness.
meanings.sent3: The prank was subjecting him to embarrassment in front of his friends.
meanings.sent4: The bright light was subjecting her eyes to strain.
meanings.sent5: The spicy food was subjecting his taste buds to a fiery sensation.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something undergo a particular process
meanings.sent1: The artist was subjecting the canvas to layers of paint.
meanings.sent2: The metal was subjecting to intense heat to be molded into shape.
meanings.sent3: The cake was subjecting to a long baking time in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was subjecting his body to rigorous training for the competition.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was subjecting to a thorough cleaning to remove the stains.
